message.content:
cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.IT. 

This paper deals with the problem of activity recognition, which is a common topic in computer vision and machine learning. The use of symbolic representation and logic programming suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The input of the system is a set of time-stamped short-term activities detected on video frames, which implies a focus on computer vision (cs.CV). The evaluation of the system is done on a benchmark dataset of surveillance videos, which suggests a focus on computer security and cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the use of a dialect of the Event Calculus to express constraints on the short-term activities suggests a focus on information theory (cs.IT).
